page.title: 17A LOCAL CHARACTER
page.content: 'Ginger' real name Arthur Pinnegar was one of the last of a number of 'Gentlemen of the road', or tramps, who used to frequent the village of Kennford. He spent a lot of his time on the Treh8ll estate near Kenn. He would work when he could and would rely on a social security pension for his main income. He would help out with grass and hedge trimming when he could, usually unpaid. His home was made from wooden struts and tarpaulin. In this he lived through all seasons and it is said that milkmen would deliver him his milk everyday. He was an active man until well into his seventies, when during a harsh winter his health deteriorated. He died in Dawlish Cottage Hospital after a short illness. He was buried in the cemetery at Kenn churchyard. A villager made a simple wooden cross for his grave.
